projectDesc.p: To the tune “Jade Butterfly”—"By Mistake" is part of The Global Medieval Sourcebook, a digital compendium of medieval texts in their original languages and in English translation. This larger project comprises computer-readable transcriptions and/or editions of texts dating from the ninth to the sixteenth century, and originating in Europe, North Africa, the Middle East, and Asia; accompanied by new English translations; high-resolution digital images of manuscript/early print sources, where available; an apparatus that includes critical introductions, textual notes and annotations; and a flexible user interface with which to navigate these materials.

interpretation.p: Texts are translated into modern English with maximum fidelity to the original text, except where it would impair comprehension or good style. Archaisms are preserved where they do not conflict with the aesthetic of the original text. Creative translation choices are marked and discussed in the critical notes.

app.rdg: To the tune “Jade Butterfly”—"By Mistake"
By mistake, I entered a narrow alley in the Pingkang Ward.
Deep in the painted eaves,
the pearl curtain slightly raised.
Among the plain and patterned silk,
I recognized a beauty whom I used to know.
Her dark eyebrows relaxed,
like beautiful extending ridges.
Her drooping green hair
was richly infused with spring mist.
I remembered the former love ties:
over a white wall like this,
some girl had peeked at Song Yu for three years.
I stayed
at the coral table,
holding a rhinoceros horn pipe,
folding the fragrant paper;
She asked for a new ci,
Tempting me with a smile, she stood before me.
Singing along to the new song I wrote,
her pearly voice grew steady.
Recalling our old love,
Her radiant face became even more enticing.
She begged me to stay.
Phoenix quilt and mandarin duck pillows,
how could I bear to turn down this heavenly chance.
